website_summaries.verdict: No matter what type of coffee you crave, this reasonably priced manual grinder does the job, looks sleek, and comes with a lifetime money-back guarantee.
pros: Includes a cleaning brush to gently clean the burrs
Container made of durable, break-proof resin, making it a sturdy option to take on camping trips
Good looks make it an excellent gift for a coffee purist
cons: Only grinds enough beans for 1-2 cups of coffee
If disassembling to clean, keep an eye on small parts because they can go missing

customer_reviews.title: Really nice finish, quality materials, and slick design. Easy adjustability!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice finish, quality materials, and slick design. Most notable feature is the ability to adjust the grinder, always gets me my preferred coarseness level (strong drip coffee). Also worked great for my expresso grind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lid design inconvenient
customer_reviews.text: Update: after using this twice, the handle started spinning - something internally stripped out and the mill is no longer functional. Returning for refund. This is a “near” replica of the Hario Mini Mill, has big ceramic burrs, and is better than the standard $15 silver hand mill found everywhere. However there is a design flaw: the grinder arm needs to be attached with a nut, therefore each time you add beans you will need to disassemble the crank arm, nut, and lid...then reassemble. Seemingly no big deal, but it’s enough of an inconvenience that I felt like I needed to write a review. Spend the extra bucks and get the Hario.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Mycoskie

customer_reviews.title: A coffee grinder that spills the beans
customer_reviews.text: I was initially very pleased with this coffee grinder but it revealed what I think is a design flow after a month or so of daily use. The plastic cover for the beans compartment comes loose, it is supposed to stay in place by pressure, I guess, but now doesn't fit tight anymore which causes coffee beans and bean fragments to fall off while grinding or even while moving the grinder around. After a few weeks of finding coffee beans all around the house, I decided to bite the bullet and write it off as a (moderate) loss.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Internal parts are plastic junk
customer_reviews.text: Well after using this a couple times I was really excited about it, grinds seemed consistent, and love the loads of settings. Reviews were great, and this was my first manual burr grinder. But after about my fifth time of using it, and maybe tenth cup of coffee, the plastic/nylon pin inside the ceramic burr has failed rendering it useless. Quite disappointed. Replacing the nylon with something more structurally stable would have guaranteed hundreds of uses with no issues I do believe.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Criner

customer_reviews.title: great grinder, excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee grinder! I use it around 4 or 5 times a week. Easy to use, easy to adjust grind, and perfect for grinding my morning coffee as I prefer to do that right before brewing. Unfortunately, my lid cracked. Plastic, really no one's fault. The grinder itself works amazingly. When I finally got around to contacting Bassani customer service through their website about where to replace a lid separately, they responded almost immediately with the offer to replace my entire grinder as parts are not sold separately. Great company; I will continue to look to them for coffee related needs.

customer_reviews.title: A satisfying grinder
customer_reviews.text: This is satisfying in the hand, and grinds coffee exactly as I need it. The adjustments are easy to make. The grinding process is fairly slow, but I expect this from a hand product. If it ground more at a time, it would be hard to turn, but it's not. It's a pleasant thing to do in the morning, and while it has a sound, it's not the harsh sound that an electric grinder makes. I am trying to reduce my carbon footprint, and having a manual grinder helps. Thanks Bassani!
customer_reviews.author: Julia Mira

customer_reviews.title: Great little manual burr grinder
customer_reviews.text: I love this little thing. It takes time to grind whole beans, though, so I don't recommend this if you want to grind a lot of beans. I use it just to make a cup or two of espresso. It grinds evenly, is easy to use and looks stylish on my counter. I just wipe it clean with a paper towel. Here's a tip: if you have an electric blade grinder, try giving your beans a head start by giving them a quick pulse and then finish in the burr grinder. It's cheating, I know, but will get you to your cup of coffee that much quicker ;)
customer_reviews.author: jrehnke

customer_reviews.title: Great little grinder, great big customer service
customer_reviews.text: This is my first hand grinder and I think a great choice. Well built, does an efficient job, very easy to adjust the settings for various grinds. And I want to mention that I had a problem of my own making (I really should pay attention to the instructions) and Bassani took care of it right away and way, way above my expectations. So if good customer service is as important to you as the product itself, you can't go wrong with this grinder.
customer_reviews.author: R G Palmer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this little Coffee Grinder
customer_reviews.text: Quite simply: designed beautifully, nice to look at and looks gorgeous on my kitchen counter, but more importantly it works just as described and it is easy to use! If you have any friends that LOVE coffee, this is a great gift! Will be repurchasing for friends and family to try out :)
customer_reviews.author: DChamS

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: This grinder works well for grinding your beans but the lid is it’s downfall. The lid doesn’t fit tight at all and if you have it full of beans they fly right out of the grinder. Poor design. I would not recommend this grinder
customer_reviews.author: john eldridge

customer_reviews.title: Bassani grinder
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased my first burr grinder for my french press. I had always used an electric spice grinder, and was getting tired of drinking more grounds than coffee. I have enjoyed this new experience of course ground beans, and would recommend this grinder to anyone. I like others have said have to say that the two cup level on the grinder is actually more like four or five tablespoons.
customer_reviews.author: William Floyd

customer_reviews.title: My favorite parts about this - it actually does a very ...
customer_reviews.text: My favorite parts about this - it actually does a very nice coarse grind for french press. The disadvantage with this compared with the Hario is the plastic lid on this requires a full dismantling of the top screw and handle to add beans each time, and you can only really store about 2-3 servings of beans.
customer_reviews.author: D. ReynoldsTop Contributor: Ham Radio

customer_reviews.title: Best taste is from the press
customer_reviews.text: This really does make a huge difference in the taste of the coffee vs an electric grinder! The coffee is unbelievably smooth. It dose take a little more time but is well worth it. Best taste is from the press, but it also makes a differnce in the drip maker! Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: This works really well, a three year old can even crank this relatively well. It's a fun thing to do together. I've made cold brew with this multiple times; I only wish it could hold more grounds as I'm constantly having to empty it (I make my cold brew in larger batches).
customer_reviews.author: runningInTheWoods

customer_reviews.title: Awesome manual grinder
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as part of a pourover set that I gifted my partner, and this couldn't have been a better pick! It's easy to adjust the ground size and it's a super consistent grind. The only downside is that it does take a minute to grind since it is manual...but I just think of it as a morning workout ;)
customer_reviews.author: Steve P

customer_reviews.title: pretty darn good.
customer_reviews.text: I tried a friend's Hario and really liked it except the handle was wobbly so I got this one with a screw on top. much better. but I just bought a second grinder for my decaf beans- a Mueller. way better. 3.9 for the Hario. 4.2 stars for the Bassani, 5 for the Mueller.
customer_reviews.author: KwaiChang

customer_reviews.title: Makes a difference
customer_reviews.text: My first experience with a burr coffee grinder and I love the difference in the taste of the coffee. It's slower, of course, than my electric grinder but worth the wait and the wee bit of extra arm action. For those of us that appreciate a wonderful cup of coffee, it's not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: JSNELL

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but it tires me out
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says but it takes so long to grind those beans down. I don't know how a manufacturer can make it faster so I can't complain. It has backed off on the grind size while I am grinding. All I have to do is tighten the nut and go at it again. Can't complain about that either because it does keep a uniform size as long as I keep that nut tightened.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
